traceability.evidence: The JSON formatter and CLI JSON branch only emit minimal fields (name, current, wanted, latest, age) and summary, but do not include vulnerabilities, dependency type, recommended version, filtered flags or filterReason as specified in prompts/008.0-DEV-JSON-OUTPUT.md. Furthermore, error handling in JSON mode prints plain-text errors to stderr instead of emitting an error object with an “error” field and timestamp in JSON. See src/json-formatter.js and the JSON branch in src/print-outdated.js for the incomplete output, and bin/dry-aged-deps.js error handlers for plain-text stderr output.
traceability.notes: While existing tests expect minimal JSON, the implemented JSON output does not satisfy the story’s acceptance criteria for “Complete Data” or “Error Handling” as defined in prompts/008.0-DEV-JSON-OUTPUT.md.
